materials.raw_text:
Acetyl chloride (Ac): 12.00 g 
 Mercury(II) chloride (Hg): 1.00 g 
 Silicon dioxide (Si): 50.00 g 
 Catalyst (optional, e.g., Triethylamine): 0.50 g

sourcing.instructions: Acetyl chloride can be purchased from chemical supply companies or online retailers. Mercury(II) chloride should be sourced from specialized chemical suppliers. Silicon dioxide can be found at laboratory supply stores or online. Triethylamine can be sourced from chemical suppliers as well.

 2. Carefully add the mercury(II) chloride to the acetyl chloride in a glass mixing container while stirring continuously. 
 3. Gradually incorporate 50.00 g of silicon dioxide into the mixture, ensuring a uniform consistency. 
 4. If using, add 0.50 g of triethylamine as a catalyst to enhance the reaction. Stir thoroughly until all components are well mixed.

steps: 1. Once cooled, pour the mixture into a mold shaped to the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.
2. Allow the material to cure in the mold for 24 hours at room temperature.
